Aguav Berry.name: Aguav Berry
Aguav Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore some HP should it find itself in a pinch. But it will become confused if it hates the Berry's taste.

Apicot Berry.name: Apicot Berry
Apicot Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its Sp. Def stat will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Aspear Berry.name: Aspear Berry
Aspear Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to thaw itself after being frozen.

Babiri Berry.name: Babiri Berry
Babiri Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Steel-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Belue Berry.name: Belue Berry
Belue Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Beauty. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Bluk Berry.name: Bluk Berry
Bluk Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Beauty. Its blue flesh is dry if eaten.

Charti Berry.name: Charti Berry
Charti Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Rock-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Cheri Berry.name: Cheri Berry
Cheri Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to free itself from paralysis.

Chesto Berry.name: Chesto Berry
Chesto Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to wake itself from sleep.

Chilan Berry.name: Chilan Berry
Chilan Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a Normal-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Chople Berry.name: Chople Berry
Chople Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Fighting-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Coba Berry.name: Coba Berry
Coba Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Flying-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Colbur Berry.name: Colbur Berry
Colbur Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Dark-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Cornn Berry.name: Cornn Berry
Cornn Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Beauty. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Custap Berry.name: Custap Berry
Custap Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to act faster should it find itself in a pinch—but only for the next move it uses.

Durin Berry.name: Durin Berry
Durin Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cleverness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Enigma Berry.name: Enigma Berry
Enigma Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to regain some HP if it is hit with a supereffective move.

Figy Berry.name: Figy Berry
Figy Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore some HP should it find itself in a pinch. But it will become confused if it hates the Berry's taste.

Ganlon Berry.name: Ganlon Berry
Ganlon Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its Defense stat will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Golden Nanab Berry.name: Golden Nanab Berry
Golden Nanab Berry.effect: A Berry that drastically calms Pokémon you're trying to catch when given to them.

Golden Pinap Berry.name: Golden Pinap Berry
Golden Pinap Berry.effect: A Berry that makes you drastically more likely to get an item when given to Pokémon you're trying to catch.

Golden Razz Berry.name: Golden Razz Berry
Golden Razz Berry.effect: A Berry that makes it drastically easier to catch Pokémon when given to them.

Grepa Berry.name: Grepa Berry
Grepa Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its Sp. Def stat.

Haban Berry.name: Haban Berry
Haban Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Dragon-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Hondew Berry.name: Hondew Berry
Hondew Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its Sp. Atk stat.

Hopo Berry.name: Hopo Berry
Hopo Berry.effect: A Berry that can be fed to a Pokémon to restore its PP. If a wild Pokémon eats one of these Berries, that Pokémon's reactions will be dulled.

Iapapa Berry.name: Iapapa Berry
Iapapa Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore some HP should it find itself in a pinch. But it will become confused if it hates the Berry's taste.

Jaboca Berry.name: Jaboca Berry
Jaboca Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a physical move, the attacker will also take damage.

Kasib Berry.name: Kasib Berry
Kasib Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Ghost-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Kebia Berry.name: Kebia Berry
Kebia Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Poison-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Kee Berry.name: Kee Berry
Kee Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a physical move, the holder's Defense stat will be boosted.

Kelpsy Berry.name: Kelpsy Berry
Kelpsy Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its Attack stat.

Lansat Berry.name: Lansat Berry
Lansat Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its critical-hit ratio will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Leppa Berry.name: Leppa Berry
Leppa Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore 10 PP to a move.

Liechi Berry.name: Liechi Berry
Liechi Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its Attack stat will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Lum Berry.name: Lum Berry
Lum Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to cure itself of any status condition it may have.

Mago Berry.name: Mago Berry
Mago Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore some HP should it find itself in a pinch. But it will become confused if it hates the Berry's taste.

Magost Berry.name: Magost Berry
Magost Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cuteness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Maranga Berry.name: Maranga Berry
Maranga Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a special move, the holder's Sp. Def stat will be boosted.

Micle Berry.name: Micle Berry
Micle Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its accuracy will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch—but only for the next move it uses.

Nanab Berry.name: Nanab Berry
Nanab Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cuteness. Its pink flesh is sweet if eaten.

Nomel Berry.name: Nomel Berry
Nomel Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Toughness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Occa Berry.name: Occa Berry
Occa Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Fire-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Oran Berry.name: Oran Berry
Oran Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore 10 HP to itself.

Pamtre Berry.name: Pamtre Berry
Pamtre Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Beauty. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Passho Berry.name: Passho Berry
Passho Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Water-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Payapa Berry.name: Payapa Berry
Payapa Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Psychic-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Pecha Berry.name: Pecha Berry
Pecha Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to lift the effects of being poisoned from itself.

Persim Berry.name: Persim Berry
Persim Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to cure itself of confusion.

Petaya Berry.name: Petaya Berry
Petaya Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its Sp. Atk stat will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Pinap Berry.name: Pinap Berry
Pinap Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Toughness. Its yellow flesh is sour if eaten.

Pomeg Berry.name: Pomeg Berry
Pomeg Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its HP stat.

Qualot Berry.name: Qualot Berry
Qualot Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its Defense stat.

Rabuta Berry.name: Rabuta Berry
Rabuta Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cleverness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Rawst Berry.name: Rawst Berry
Rawst Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to cure itself of a burn.

Razz Berry.name: Razz Berry
Razz Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Coolness. Its red flesh is spicy if eaten.

Rindo Berry.name: Rindo Berry
Rindo Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Grass-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Roseli Berry.name: Roseli Berry
Roseli Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Fairy-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Rowap Berry.name: Rowap Berry
Rowap Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a special move, the attacker will also take damage.

Salac Berry.name: Salac Berry
Salac Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, its Speed stat will be boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Shuca Berry.name: Shuca Berry
Shuca Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Ground-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Silver Nanab Berry.name: Silver Nanab Berry
Silver Nanab Berry.effect: A Berry that calms Pokémon you're trying to catch when given to them.

Silver Pinap Berry.name: Silver Pinap Berry
Silver Pinap Berry.effect: A Berry that makes you more likely to get an item when given to Pokémon you're trying to catch.

Silver Razz Berry.name: Silver Razz Berry
Silver Razz Berry.effect: A Berry that makes it easier to catch Pokémon when given to them.

Sitrus Berry.name: Sitrus Berry
Sitrus Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore a small amount of HP to itself.

Spelon Berry.name: Spelon Berry
Spelon Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cuteness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Starf Berry.name: Starf Berry
Starf Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, one of its stats will be sharply boosted should it find itself in a pinch.

Tamato Berry.name: Tamato Berry
Tamato Berry.effect: If a Pokémon is fed this Berry, it will grow more friendly, but it will lose base points for its Speed stat.

Tanga Berry.name: Tanga Berry
Tanga Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Bug-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Wacan Berry.name: Wacan Berry
Wacan Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Electric-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Watmel Berry.name: Watmel Berry
Watmel Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cleverness. This Berry is rare in other regions.

Wepear Berry.name: Wepear Berry
Wepear Berry.effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance Cleverness. Its green flesh is bitter if eaten.

Wiki Berry.name: Wiki Berry
Wiki Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holds one of these Berries, it will be able to restore some HP should it find itself in a pinch. But it will become confused if it hates the Berry's taste.

Yache Berry.name: Yache Berry
Yache Berry.effect: If a Pokémon holding this Berry is hit with a supereffective Ice-type move, the power of that move will be weakened.

Armor Fossil.name: Armor Fossil
Armor Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks to be from some kind of protective collar.

Claw Fossil.name: Claw Fossil
Claw Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It appears to be a fragment of a claw.

Cover Fossil.name: Cover Fossil
Cover Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It appears as though it could be part of a creature's back.

Dome Fossil.name: Dome Fossil
Dome Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It could be a shell or carapace.

Fossilized Bird.name: Fossilized Bird
Fossilized Bird.effect: A fossil piece left behind by a prehistoric Pokémon that once soared through the sky. What it looked like is a mystery.

Fossilized Dino.name: Fossilized Dino
Fossilized Dino.effect: A fossil piece left behind by a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

Fossilized Drake.name: Fossilized Drake
Fossilized Drake.effect: A fossil piece left behind by a prehistoric Pokémon that once roamed the land. What it looked like is a mystery.

Fossilized Fish.name: Fossilized Fish
Fossilized Fish.effect: A fossil piece left behind by a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

Helix Fossil.name: Helix Fossil
Helix Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It might be a piece of a seashell.

Jaw Fossil.name: Jaw Fossil
Jaw Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks as if it could be a piece of a large jaw.

Old Amber.name: Old Amber
Old Amber.effect: A piece of amber that still contains the genetic material of a prehistoric Pokémon. It's clear with a tawny, reddish tint.

Plume Fossil.name: Plume Fossil
Plume Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon said to be an ancestor to modern bird Pokémon. It looks as if it could have come from part of some creature's wing.

Root Fossil.name: Root Fossil
Root Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It looks as if it could be part of a plant's root.

Sail Fossil.name: Sail Fossil
Sail Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like the impression from a skin sail.

Skull Fossil.name: Skull Fossil
Skull Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It appears as though it's part of a head.

Antidote.name: Antidote
Antidote.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can be used to lift the effects of being poisoned from a Pokémon.

Awakening.name: Awakening
Awakening.effect: A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can be used to rouse a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

Berry Juice.name: Berry Juice
Berry Juice.effect: A 100 percent pure juice made from Berries. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a Pokémon.

Big Malasada.name: Big Malasada
Big Malasada.effect: The Alola region's famous fried confection. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Burn Heal.name: Burn Heal
Burn Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used to cure a Pokémon suffering from a burn.

Casteliacone.name: Casteliacone
Casteliacone.effect: Castelia City's specialty: soft-serve ice cream. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Elixir.name: Elixir
Elixir.effect: A medicine that can be used to restore 10 PP to all four moves that a Pokémon knows.

Energy Powder.name: Energy Powder
Energy Powder.effect: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a Pokémon.

Energy Root.name: Energy Root
Energy Root.effect: A very bitter medicinal root. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a Pokémon.

Ether.name: Ether
Ether.effect: A medicine that can be used to restore 10 PP to a single move that a Pokémon knows.

Fine Remedy.name: Fine Remedy
Fine Remedy.effect: This item will heal 100 HP from your Pokémon but reduces the friendship by 10.

Fresh Water.name: Fresh Water
Fresh Water.effect:
Heals a Pokémon by 50HP. From Pokémon Sun & Moon it heals a Pokémon by 30HP.
In Red, Blue & Yellow, you can give it to a Saffron City Guardsman to obtain access to Saffron City.
In Celadon City, you can give it to a thirsty girl to obtain TM13 in Red, Blue & Yellow and TM16 in FRLG.

Full Heal.name: Full Heal
Full Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Full Restore.name: Full Restore
Full Restore.effect: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the max HP of a Pokémon and cure any status condition it may have.

Heal Powder.name: Heal Powder
Heal Powder.effect: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Hyper Potion.name: Hyper Potion
Hyper Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a Pokémon.

Ice Heal.name: Ice Heal
Ice Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating freezing. It can be used to thaw out a Pokémon that has been frozen solid.

Jubilife Muffin.name: Jubilife Muffin
Jubilife Muffin.effect: A hidden gem gaining popularity in Jubilife Village and beloved by Pokémon. This sweet treat can be fed to a Pokémon to cure any status condition it may have.

Lava Cookie.name: Lava Cookie
Lava Cookie.effect: Lavaridge Town's local specialty. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Lemonade.name: Lemonade
Lemonade.effect:
Heals a Pokémon by 80HP. From Pokémon Sun & Moon it heals a Pokémon by 70HP.
In Red, Blue & Yellow, you can give it to a Saffron City Guardsman to obtain access to Saffron City.
In Celadon City, you can give it to a thirsty girl to obtain TM49 in Red, Blue & Yellow and TM33 in FRLG.
In FireRed & LeafGreen, take to trainer at Memorial Pillar to give to his deceased Onix. You receive TM42.

Lumiose Galette.name: Lumiose Galette
Lumiose Galette.effect: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Max Elixir.name: Max Elixir
Max Elixir.effect: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the max PP of all four moves that a Pokémon knows.

Max Ether.name: Max Ether
Max Ether.effect: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the max PP of a single move that a Pokémon knows.

Max Honey.name: Max Honey
Max Honey.effect: This item is used in the Isle of Armor to create Max Soup, which allows for Pokémon to Gigantamax if possible. It also acts like a Max Revive and can restore a fainted Pokémon to full Hit Points.

Max Potion.name: Max Potion
Max Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to fully restore the max HP of a Pokémon.

Max Revive.name: Max Revive
Max Revive.effect: Completely revives a fainted Pokémon to its maximum Hit Points.

Moomoo Milk.name: Moomoo Milk
Moomoo Milk.effect: A bottle of highly nutritious milk. It can be used to restore 100 HP to a Pokémon.

Old Gateau.name: Old Gateau
Old Gateau.effect: A hidden gem found in the Old Chateau. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Paralyze Heal.name: Paralyze Heal
Paralyze Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating paralysis. It can be used to free a Pokémon that has been paralyzed.

Pewter Crunchies.name: Pewter Crunchies
Pewter Crunchies.effect: Pewter City's famous crunchy snack. They can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Potion.name: Potion
Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a Pokémon.

Rage Candy Bar.name: Rage Candy Bar
Rage Candy Bar.effect: Mahogany Town's famous candy. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Remedy.name: Remedy
Remedy.effect: An herbal medicine that can restore 60 HP to a Pokémon, just as a Potion does. Yet the bitter taste will make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.

Revival Herb.name: Revival Herb
Revival Herb.effect: A very bitter medicinal herb. It can be used to revive a Pokémon that has fainted. It also fully restores the Pokémon's max HP.

Revive.name: Revive
Revive.effect: Restores a fainted Pokémon to 50% of their current maximum possible Hit Points.

Roto HP Restore.name: Roto HP Restore
Roto HP Restore.effect: One of the Rotom Powers. When used, it fully restores the max HP of your battling Pokémon.

Roto PP Restore.name: Roto PP Restore
Roto PP Restore.effect: One of the Rotom Powers. When used, it fully restores the max PP of your battling Pokémon.

Sacred Ash.name: Sacred Ash
Sacred Ash.effect: Ash that can be used to revive all party Pokémon that have fainted. It also fully restores the Pokémon's max HP.

Shalour Sable.name: Shalour Sable
Shalour Sable.effect: Shalour City's famous shortbread. It can be used to cure any status condition a Pokémon may have.

Soda Pop.name: Soda Pop
Soda Pop.effect: A highly carbonated soda drink. It can be used to restore 50 HP to a Pokémon.

Super Potion.name: Super Potion
Super Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a Pokémon.

Superb Remedy.name: Superb Remedy
Superb Remedy.effect: An herbal medicine that can restore 150 HP to a Pokémon, just as a Hyper Potion does. Yet the bitter taste will make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.

Sweet Heart.name: Sweet Heart
Sweet Heart.effect: A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a Pokémon.

Azure Flute.name: Azure Flute
Azure Flute.effect: This item requires you to go to the Spear Pillar in Diamond, Pearl & Platinum. When there, you will be prompted to play the Flute. When you do, a new area opens up where Arceus lives.

Enigma Stone.name: Enigma Stone
Enigma Stone.effect: This item, when taken to the Pewter Museum, will be discovered to be the Soul Dew and given to you. It will also activate Latios & Latias to appear in Pewter City in HeartGold & SoulSilver respectively.

Eon Ticket.name: Eon Ticket
Eon Ticket.effect: This item allows you to take the SS Aqua to Southern Island where Latios or Latias dwell.

GS Ball.name: GS Ball
GS Ball.effect: This item is to be taken to Ilex Forest. If you go and place it in the Shrine there, Celebi will come and challenge you.

Liberty Pass.name: Liberty Pass
Liberty Pass.effect: This item requires you to go to Liberty Pier in Castelia City. With this item, you can enter the boat and get taken to Liberty Garden Tower where you'll encounter Team Plasma and Victini.

Lock Capsule.name: Lock Capsule
Lock Capsule.effect: A sturdy Capsule that can only be opened with a special key. In Pokémon Black & White, you can take the Lock Capsule to a character within Castelia City, Mr. Lock. Mr. Lock will tell you that the item inside got hidden within to protect it from Team Rocket. He will open it and give you TM95.

Member Card.name: Member Card
Member Card.effect: This item requires you to go to the lock house in Canalave City in Diamond, Pearl & Platinum. When there, you will be able to unlock the door and enter. As you go for a nap, you will wake up on New Moon Island where Darkrai dwells.

Oak's Letter.name: Oak's Letter
Oak's Letter.effect: A letter from Professor Oak. Written in it is a request for you to go to Route 224.

Secret Key.name: Secret Key
Secret Key.effect:
In Red, Blue, Yellow, FireRed & LeafGreen, this item is used to open Cinnabar Island's Gym after it has been locked.
In Pokémon Platinum, this item can be utilised to access a new room in the Eterna City Galactic Building. In this room, there are five appliances that allow you to change Rotom's form.

Old Sea Map.name: Old Sea Map
Old Sea Map.effect: This item allows you to take the SS Aqua to Faraway Island where Mew dwells.

Bead Mail.name: Bead Mail
Bead Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL to be held by a Pokémon. It will bear the print of the Pokémon holding it.

Bridge Mail D.name: Bridge Mail D
Bridge Mail D.effect: Stationery featuring a print of a red drawbridge. Let a Pokémon hold it for use.

Bridge Mail M.name: Bridge Mail M
Bridge Mail M.effect: Stationery featuring a print of an arched bridge. Let a Pokémon hold it for use.

Bridge Mail S.name: Bridge Mail S
Bridge Mail S.effect: Stationery featuring a print of a sky-piercing bridge. Let a Pokémon hold it for use.

Bridge Mail T.name: Bridge Mail T
Bridge Mail T.effect: Stationery featuring a print of a steel suspension bridge. Let a Pokémon hold it for use.

Bridge Mail V.name: Bridge Mail V
Bridge Mail V.effect: Stationery featuring a print of a brick bridge. Let a Pokémon hold it for use.

Favored Mail.name: Favored Mail
Favored Mail.effect: Stationery designed for writing about your favorite things. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Glitter Mail.name: Glitter Mail
Glitter Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute PIKACHU print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Greet Mail.name: Greet Mail
Greet Mail.effect: Stationery designed for introductory greetings. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Harbor Mail.name: Harbor Mail
Harbor Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute WINGULL print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Inquiry Mail.name: Inquiry Mail
Inquiry Mail.effect: Stationery designed for writing questions. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Like Mail.name: Like Mail
Like Mail.effect: Stationery designed for writing recommendations. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Mech Mail.name: Mech Mail
Mech Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute MAGNEMITE print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Orange Mail.name: Orange Mail
Orange Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute ZIGZAGOON print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

RSVP Mail.name: RSVP Mail
RSVP Mail.effect: Stationery designed for invitations. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Reply Mail.name: Reply Mail
Reply Mail.effect: Stationery designed for writing a reply. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Retro Mail.name: Retro Mail
Retro Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a print of three cute Pokémon. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Shadow Mail.name: Shadow Mail
Shadow Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute DUSKULL print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Thanks Mail.name: Thanks Mail
Thanks Mail.effect: Stationery designed for a thank-you note. Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Tropic Mail.name: Tropic Mail
Tropic Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute BELLOSSOM print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Wave Mail.name: Wave Mail
Wave Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute WAILMER print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Wood Mail.name: Wood Mail
Wood Mail.effect: A piece of MAIL featuring a cute SLAKOTH print. It is to be held by a Pokémon.

Aux Evasion.name: Aux Evasion
Aux Evasion.effect: An item that makes moves less likely to strike a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle. This item increases the Pokémon's Evasion by 1 stage during battle.

Aux Guard.name: Aux Guard
Aux Guard.effect: An item that sharply boosts the defensive stats of a Pokémon in battle. These effects disappear if the Pokémon leaves the battle. This item increases both Defense & Special Defense by 2 stages during the battle.

Aux Power.name: Aux Power
Aux Power.effect: An item that sharply boosts the offensive stats of a Pokémon in battle. These effects disappear if the Pokémon leaves the battle. This item increases both Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages during the battle.

Aux Powerguard.name: Aux Powerguard
Aux Powerguard.effect: An item that sharply boosts the offensive and defensive stats of a Pokémon in battle. These effects disappear if the Pokémon leaves the battle. This item boosts both offensive and defensive stats by 2 stages in battle.

Choice Dumpling.name: Choice Dumpling
Choice Dumpling.effect: This item increases the damage of the first move used after using the item by 50%, but increases the damage done to the Pokémon as well. The Pokémoncan only use that move.

Dire Hit.name: Dire Hit
Dire Hit.effect: In battle, it raises the Pokémon's Critical Hit ratio by 1 until the battle is over or the Pokémon is withdrawn. Increases Pokémon's Happiness.

Guard Spec..name: Guard Spec.
Guard Spec..effect: In battle, it prevents the opponent from reducing the Pokémon's stats for five turns. It raises the Pokémon's Happiness.

Roto Boost.name: Roto Boost
Roto Boost.effect: Used in battle, this item will increase each of your Active Pokémon's stats by one stage.

Swap Snack.name: Swap Snack
Swap Snack.effect: This item swaps the Attack & Special Attack for a Pokémon's Defense & Special Defense.

Twice-Spiced Radish.name: Twice-Spiced Radish
Twice-Spiced Radish.effect: This item increases the power of moves by 50%

X Accuracy.name: X Accuracy
X Accuracy.effect:
In battle, it raises the Pokémon's Accuracy by 1 stage until the battle is over or the Pokémon is withdrawn. Increases Pokémon's Happiness.
As of Pokémon Sun & Moon, it boosts by 2 stages.

X Attack.name: X Attack
X Attack.effect:
In battle, it raises the Pokémon's Attack by 1 stage until the battle is over or the Pokémon is withdrawn. Increases Pokémon's Happiness.
As of Pokémon Sun & Moon, it boosts by 2 stages.

X Defense.name: X Defense
X Defense.effect:
In battle, it raises the Pokémon's Defence by 1 stage until the battle is over or the Pokémon is withdrawn. Increases Pokémon's Happiness.

X Sp. Atk.name: X Sp. Atk
X Sp. Atk.effect:
In battle, it raises the Pokémon's Special Attack by 1 stage until the battle is over or the Pokémon is withdrawn. Increases Pokémon's Happiness.
As of Pokémon Sun & Moon, it boosts by 2 stages.
As of Pokémon X & Y it was renamed to X Sp. Atk.
